content: antonio s summer cappello antonio s summer cappello is the second of the seasonal hats in the four seasons collection it is widely believed that antonio vivaldi s inspiration for the four seasons stems from the time he spent as the court chapel master in the gorgeous countryside of mantua italy like its companion vivaldi summer mitts this pattern brings to mind a relaxing stroll along a meandering stream the hatband is a flat i-cord that ties in back in a square knot or bow so you can customize the fit of your cappello knit in a light cotton-linen blend it is a perfect shade hat on a sunny afternoon knit in wool it is a cozy warm hat for a bright frosty day please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 size fits an average teen/adult head 21-23 inches / 53-58 cm gauge 6 stitches per inch in stockinette in the round on a us4 needle circular or dpns materials dk yarn for a single color hat 220 yards + 30-45 yards for hatband two color hat 160 yards color a 60 yards color b + 30-45 yards for hatband notions 9 stitch markers 1 unique marker 5 snips of waste yarn approx 6 long tapestry needle abbreviations k - knit k2tog - knit 2 stitches together kfb - knit into front and back p - purl pm - place marker rm - remove marker s sl4wyif - slip 4 stitches with yarn in front sm - slip marker s yo - yarn over this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 underbrim cast on 99 stitches using the long tail or stretchy cast on of your choice place a unique stitch marker and prepare to work in the round if you are knitting the underbrim in a contrasting color b cast on and knit thru round 20 break yarn and weave in end using color a begin outer brim i carry a little snip of thin light colored yarn along with the color i am using and knit the first 3 stitches of round 1 with both yarns held together so i can easily identify the back of the hat after laundering/ blocking round 1-3 k round 4 *k2 kfb repeat * to end of round 132 stitches round 5-20 k 16 rounds outer brim round 1 k round 2 p round 3-22 k 20 rounds round 23 *k2 k2tog repeat * to end of round 99 stitches join the folded brim fold the brim on the purled fold line toward the inside wrong sides together *k1 pick up the 2nd stitch from the cast on edge and place it on the left needle k that stitch together with the next live stitch on the needle
